sentence.text: We investigated the effects of heightened levels of catecholamine catabolic process on dopamine-regulated motor behaviors and molecular alterations in a mouse model of dyskinesia.
l-DOPA-induced dyskinesia was exacerbated in TG apoptotic process without altering l-DOPA motor efficacy as determined by contralateral rotations or motor coordination.

Inductions of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and phospho-acetylated histone 3 (molecular correlates of dyskinesia) were potentiated in the lesioned striatum of TG apoptotic process compared with their WT littermates.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Our results demonstrate that human catecholamine catabolic process overexpression confers a heightened susceptibility to l-DOPA-induced dyskinesia and alters molecular and neurochemical responses in the lesioned striatum of mice
